It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, temperate environments. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Osbeckia bonplandiana is part of the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its fibrous root system and hairy stems.
